meanings.definition: A large, powerful breed of dog used for guarding and protection.
meanings.sent1: The bandog stood watch over the farm, ready to protect it from any danger.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bandog patrolling the estate, ensuring its safety.
meanings.sent3: The bandog wagged its tail happily as it chased away a pesky raccoon.
meanings.sent4: The bandog's bark was like a warning bell, alerting everyone to potential intruders.
meanings.sent5: The bandog's imposing presence made trespassers think twice before approaching.

meanings.definition: To restrain or tie up with a bandog.
meanings.sent1: He had to bandog the unruly horse to prevent it from running away.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to bandog the gate shut to keep the animals from escaping.
meanings.sent3: She had to bandog the suitcase closed because the zipper broke.
meanings.sent4: The storm was so strong that it felt like it would bandog the trees to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The magician used an invisible force to bandog the volunteer's hands together.

meanings.sent1: He was known as the bandog of the office, always ready to argue with anyone.
meanings.sent2: The bandog in the meeting wouldn't back down from his opinion, no matter what.
meanings.sent3: The bandog of the group always had a sharp comeback for every joke.
meanings.sent4: Her competitive spirit made her the bandog of the sports team, pushing everyone to do better.
meanings.sent5: The bandog of the debate team never shied away from a challenge, always eager to prove a point.
